intro: Gerascanthus flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered gerascanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae, which includes geraniums and other related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough, textured surface. Gerascanthus flavescens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
